pullRequest.body:
The `#find_syntax` command takes as input a string `str` and retrieves from the environment
all the candidates for `syntax` terms that contain the string `str`.

It also makes a very crude effort at regenerating what the syntax looks like, by inspecting the
`Expr`ession tree of the corresponding parser.


[Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/113488-general/topic/Finding.20syntax)

---

In order to save CI time and effort, only `Mathlib.lean` and `Mathlib/Tactic.lean` import the new command: this can change, if there is interest in the command!

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [8fed0d3c47](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17986/commits/8fed0d3c477e61f6e0bb7762621c3de8a9e79c7f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Tactic`|1|
| `Mathlib.Tactic.FindSyntax` (new file)|18|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ extractSymbols`
`+ litToString`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I skimmed the code very very quickly, but I like the high-level idea, and no matter the implementation it's better to have it than not.

Thanks!

bors r+

Build failed:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12449969485/job/34756259196)

@adomani it looks like all this need is to `import Mathlib.Init`. I would just do it myself, but thought that maybe there was an explicit reason you didn't.

Please fix the error and I'll merge this, thanks!

@j-loreaux Thanks for the prompt: I had missed that this PR had not been merged.

I also intended to make the tests less wordy, so that they would not break with every new introduced syntax.  This fix is present in the current version.

Looks like this PR just needs merging @adomani 

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.
bors merge

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12692335831/job/35377432451)

I had missed the error in the tests, since the `#guard_msgs` used the order on `HashSet` on my computer, but the order on the remote branch was different!

I added a sorting step that should prevent similar failures in the future.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12693400565/job/35380886212)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12693400565/job/35380886622)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: the `#find_syntax` command
